frameDefinitions: The words in this frame describe situations in which a Perpetrator forcibly seizes control over a Victim's Vehicle to gain some end.  ''
An Excreter excretes Excreta. 'Principal Skinner burped on me.'
An Agent matches location with an Entity in order to fulfill some  Purpose.
A Traveller boards a Vehicle that they intend to use as a means of transportation either as a passenger or as a driver.
A Traveller leaves from or dismounts a Vehicle.
These are words describing situations in which a Perpetrator wrongs a Victim by taking something (Goods) from them.
frameExamples: French farmers have <t>hijacked</t> a lorry and destroyed its load of strawberries.
I ca n't remember how many times he <t>visited</t> ! DNI
On the 5th of December, 1834, we <t>embarked</t> on board the merchant ship Hellespont.
Half of the team <t>held</t> <t>up</t> the tellers while the others were stationed to report the arrival of police.
listRoleDefinitions: This is the person (or other agent) who forcibly seizes control over a vehicle to gain some end.
This is the means of transportation which gets under the control of the perpetrator. Example: The terrorists hijacked <fex name='Vehicle'>the plane</fex>.
This role describes the people that are suffering as a result of the <fen>Perpetrator</fen>'s action.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Excreta</fen> is the waste expelled by the body.
The <fen>Excreter</fen> is the agent who excretes the <fen>Excreta</fen>.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the starting point of the <fen>Excreta</fen>'s motion.
When the <fen>Excreter</fen> engages in excretion.
This role identifieis the <fen>Place</fen> where the excretion occurs.
The sentient entity that is temporarily with the <fen>Entity</fen> in order to fulfil some <fen>Purpose</fen>.

The physical entity that is permanently associated with entities or characteristics that the <fen>Agent</fen> wishes to use for some <fen>Purpose</fen>.  During the visit, the <fen>Agent</fen> matches location with the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which a visit is made.
A description of the position of the <fen>Agent</fen> during the visit.
The <fen>Traveller</fen> is the entity which boards the <fen>Vehicle</fen>.
The <fen>Vehicle</fen> is the intended means of conveyance of the <fen>Traveller</fen>.
When the boarding of the <fen>Vehicle</fen> takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Traveller</fen> boards the <fen>Vehicle</fen>.
The <fen>Traveller</fen> is the entity which disembarks from the <fen>Vehicle</fen>.
The <fen>Vehicle</fen> is the means of conveyance that the <fen>Traveller</fen> disembarks from.
When the disembarking of the <fen>Vehicle</fen> takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Traveller</fen> disembarks from the <fen>Vehicle</fen>.
The <fen>Perpetrator</fen> is the person (or other agent) that takes the <fen>Goods</fen> away by force or threats.
The <fen>Victim</fen> is the person (or other sentient being or group) that owns the <fen>Goods</fen> before they are taken away by the <fen>Perpetrator</fen>.
Source is the initial location of the goods, before they change location.
The <fen>Time</fen> indicates when the Robbery occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the Robbery occurs.
listRoleExamples: The rebels skyjacked a plane <fex>with 89 passangers</fex>.
Dr. Nick vomited <fex>puke</fex> across the table.
At approximately 07:30 hours <fex>we</fex> emplaned in England and after circling to gather other units that made up the 1st Airborne Army, we headed for the Rhine.
When he had mounted <fex>the horse</fex>, his armour glittered in the sun, and he looked so brave and handsome.
Therese entrained <fex>at 9am on 4 October</fex> for the Brandhoek area. .
You can get on the shuttle bus <fex>at the Bank of America across from the BART station</fex>.
<fex>We</fex> got off at the wrong bus stop.
The victim stopped the tractor and dismounted <fex>from it</fex>.
<fex>Yesterday</fex>, we alighted onto this tiny hilly island, site of a Singaporean October festival.
They ROBBED a bank in North Berkeley <fex>last May</fex>.
They robbed a bank <fex>in North Berkeley</fex>.
